source_sentence: 與眾俱來受供養)一心奉請東方滿月世界消災延壽熾盛光王世尊(偈同改名前但下同)一心奉請西方教主接引導師無量壽世尊一心奉請南方寶生世尊一心奉請北方微妙勝世尊一心奉請一切世間樂見上大精進世尊一心奉請種種摩尼清淨建立世尊一心奉請普現色身光世尊一心奉請定光世尊一心奉請相好光明世尊妙音勝世尊一心奉請無量音聲世尊一心奉請大通智勝世尊一心奉請解脫王世尊美音王世尊一心奉請清淨世尊清淨施世尊一心奉請威德自在王世尊謗不動世尊一心奉請彌勒世尊舍利光王世尊一心奉請盡虗空徧法界十方三世一切諸佛世尊一心奉請盡虗空徧法界十方三世一切尊法一心奉請盡虗空徧法界十方三世一切諸舍利寶塔一心奉請大智文殊師利菩薩大悲觀世音菩薩摩訶薩一心奉請大行普賢王菩薩地藏菩薩摩訶薩一心奉請大慈悲佛母摩耶菩薩摩訶薩一心奉請虗空藏菩薩金剛藏菩薩摩訶薩一心奉請安住地神菩薩婆刪婆演帝夜神菩薩摩訶薩一心奉請金剛手秘密王菩薩善現菩薩摩訶薩一心奉請淨諸業障菩薩清淨慧菩薩摩訶薩一心奉請藥王菩薩藥上菩薩摩訶薩一心奉請普眼菩薩善會菩薩摩訶薩一心奉請馬鳴菩薩龍樹菩薩圓滿藏菩薩摩訶薩一心奉請歷代祖師菩薩摩訶薩一心奉請盡虗空徧法界十方三世一切諸大聲聞緣覺賢聖僧(眾唱云)一心奉請大梵天王帝釋尊天護世四王欲色無色諸大天王獲佛舍利壇塔伽藍守護持呪諸善神王海龍八部天曹地府水陸空行一切神祇并諸眷屬上所奉請釋迦牟尼文佛。

translation: single-mindedly paying homage to the Bhagavān, the World Honored One, the Pure Almsgiver

source_sentence: 一心頂禮威德自在王世尊謗不動世尊一心頂禮彌勒世尊舍利光王世尊一心頂禮盡虗空徧法界十方三世一切諸佛世尊一心頂禮盡虗空徧法界十方三世一切尊一心頂禮盡虗空徧法界十方三世一切諸舍利寶塔一心頂禮大智文殊師利菩薩大悲觀世音菩薩摩訶薩一心頂禮大行普賢王菩薩地藏菩薩摩訶薩一心頂禮大慈悲佛母摩耶菩薩摩訶薩一心頂禮虗空藏菩薩金剛藏菩薩摩訶薩一心頂禮安住地神菩薩婆刪婆演帝夜神菩薩摩訶薩一心頂禮金剛手祕密王菩薩善現菩薩摩訶薩一心頂禮淨諸業障菩薩清淨慧菩薩摩訶薩一心頂禮藥王菩薩藥上菩薩摩訶薩一心頂禮普現菩薩善會菩薩摩訶薩一心頂禮馬鳴菩薩龍樹菩薩圓滿藏菩薩摩訶薩一心頂禮歷代祖師菩薩摩訶薩一心頂禮盡虗空徧法界十方三世一切諸大聲聞緣覺賢聖僧一心奉為大梵天王帝釋尊天護世四王欲色無色諸大天王護佛舍利壇塔伽藍守護持呪諸善神王海龍八部天曹地府水陸空行一切靈祇并諸眷屬頂禮三寶第八具通懺悔(眾唱云)敬為十方世界六道眾生歸投三寶求哀懺悔(執爐下拜想云)。
translation: 一心頂禮威德自在王世尊謗不動世尊一心頂禮彌勒世尊舍利光王世尊一心頂禮盡虗空徧法界十方三世一切諸佛世尊一心頂禮盡虗空徧法界十方三世一切尊一心頂禮盡虗空徧法界十方三世一切諸舍利寶塔一心頂禮大智文殊師利菩薩大悲觀世音菩薩摩訶薩一心頂禮大行普賢王菩薩地藏菩薩摩訶薩一心頂禮大慈悲佛母摩耶菩薩摩訶薩一心頂禮虗空藏菩薩金剛藏菩薩摩訶薩一心頂禮安住地神菩薩婆刪婆演帝夜神菩薩摩訶薩一心頂禮金剛手祕密王菩薩善現菩薩摩訶薩一心頂禮淨諸業障菩薩清淨慧菩薩摩訶薩一心頂禮藥王菩薩藥上菩薩摩訶薩一心頂禮普現菩薩善會菩薩摩訶薩一心頂禮馬鳴菩薩龍樹菩薩圓滿藏菩薩摩訶薩一心頂禮歷代祖師菩薩摩訶薩一心頂禮盡虗空徧法界十方三世一切諸大聲聞緣覺賢聖僧一心奉為大梵天王帝釋尊天護世四王欲色無色諸大天王護佛舍利壇塔伽藍守護持呪諸善神王海龍八部天曹地府水陸空行一切靈祇并諸眷屬頂禮三寶第八具通懺悔(眾唱云)敬為十方世界六道眾生歸投三寶求哀懺悔(執爐下拜想云)。
(Since beginningless time.
I and sentient beings have turned our backs on the truth and toward delusion.
We've turned our backs on the truth and turned toward delusion.
We've been bubbling over with the dust and toil.
We've been reincarnated in the six destinies.
There's no point of escape.
We don't meet a wise teacher.
They don't honor the Three Treasures.
They create numerous evils.
They aren't afraid of the three destinies.
They don't believe in the law of cause and effect.
They lack a sense of shame.
As a result, he'll perish in the three realms.
He was lost to the three realms.
Therefore, today.
I'd like to pay respect to the buddhas.
In front of the stūpa of the Buddha's relics.
He'll give rise to a great sense of shame.
He explains in detail the causes and effects.
He arouses great fear.
He pays homage to the Three Treasures.
He reveals his repentance.
He stops past evils and diligently cultivates good qualities.
He diligently cultivates good qualities.
From now on.
I won't retrogress in my pursuit of the path.
In order to pursue enlightenment.
It'll broadly benefit all sentient beings.
The buddhas of the ten directions.
They have great compassion.
They've heard my repentance.
They'll all attain purity.'')
(After contemplating this, he called out, saying.)
"Monks (someone) and so forth.
We're all sentient beings.
They're all pure in nature.
They are clear, penetrating, and perfectly luminous.
They contain myriad virtues.
It's most marvelous and most true.
All buddhas share the same knowledge.
All things are equally spiritual.
They're all conditioned by beginningless deluded perception.
They cling to and rush about.
They're like sand and turbulent water.
They become confused and ignorant.
Following the nature of affliction.
They create bad actions.
The five heinous crimes and ten unwholesome kinds of behavior.
They denigrate the great vehicle.
They don't denigrate the Three Treasures.
They slander religious practitioners.
They bully the eternal abbot.
They disrupt the harmony of the saṃgha.
He teaches the Dharma in an impure way.
He doesn't teach people the Vinaya.
He covers up mistakes and errors.
He indulges greed and anger.
He lusts for profit and nourishment on the inside.
Outwardly, he demonstrates dignified behavior.
They violate the precepts and disrupt the Dharma.
He disobeys his teacher and venerable.
He's neither conscience nor shame.
Their evil thoughts are blazing.
Such grave and minor offenses are beyond explanation.
There's no way to explain them all.
Because of these causes and conditions.
At the end of their lives, they'll be sentenced to an unremitting hell.
They'll be sentenced to a fierce mountain of fire and a sword.
It'll prepare them for the many sufferings of babies.
There are a thousand million billion eons.
There's no possibility of escape.
Again, today.
Their bodies are torn by numerous sufferings.
They are sicknesses and afflictions.
They hinder my cultivation.

source_sentence: 今對舍利寶塔釋迦本師(一拜)。
translation: Now, I'd like to pay homage to the Śāriputra's jeweled stūpa, the original teacher Śākyamuni (one prostration).
"I'd like to join the buddhas of the ten directions.
They've been kind and compassionate fathers to us.
They have compassion for us.
Give rise to a mind of great compassion.
Accept my repentance.
Serious sins will be ceased.
All evil is removed.
It will purify my body and mind.
I'll be saturated with the taste of the Dharma.
I recite and memorize the secret dhāraṇī.
I'll realize entry into the ocean of all merits.
All my vows are fulfilled.
I'll fulfill and consummate them (rises in the clouds).

source_sentence: 懺悔已歸命禮三寶(一拜)。
translation: After confessing his sins, he returned to the Three Treasures and paid homage (one prostration).

source_sentence: 第九恭持呪心(首者白云)
translation: Ninth, he respectfully upholds the dhāraṇī (the chief one says, "White cloud").
It was then that the Bhagavān addressed the masses.
He told the crowd.
"Now, I'm going to explain this dhāraṇī to the king of teachers.

source_sentence: 此陀羅尼能成就無上菩提。
translation: 'This dhāraṇī accomplishes unsurpassed enlightenment.'
If someone accepts it.
It can remove all wrong actions.
He'll attain physical purity.
Perhaps there's someone who seeks a long life.
Those who seek wealth and prosperity ...
Those who seek an official position ...
Those who seek a man or woman.
Those who seek birth in the buddha lands of the ten directions.
...and so forth, all the things they seek will be accomplished.
They'll all attain them.
He then explains the dhāraṇī, saying.

source_sentence: 曩莫薩嚩怛佗(引)孽多南(引)(一)　唵(二)　尾補攞孽陛(三)　摩尼鉢囉(二合)陛(四)　怛佗多(五)　你捺捨寧(六)　摩抳摩抳(七)　蘇(上)鉢囉(二合)陛(八)　尾摩黎(九)　娑(引)孽囉(十)　儼鼻[口*(上/矢)*(入/米)](十一)　吽(十二)　吽(十三)　入嚩(二合)攞(十四)　沒馱尾盧抧帝(十五)　麌呬夜(二合)地瑟恥(二合)多(上)孽陛(十六)　娑嚩(二合)(引)訶(十七)(或一百八徧或四十九徧)(遶壇畢首者白云)。
translation: 曩莫薩嚩怛佗(引)孽多南(引)(一)　唵(二)　尾補攞孽陛(三)　摩尼鉢囉(二合)陛(四)　怛佗多(五)　你捺捨寧(六)　摩抳摩抳(七)　蘇(上)鉢囉(二合)陛(八)　尾摩黎(九)　娑(引)孽囉(十)　儼鼻[口*(上/矢)*(入/米)](十一)　吽(十二)　吽(十三)　入嚩(二合)攞(十四)　沒馱尾盧抧帝(十五)　麌呬夜(二合)地瑟恥(二合)多(上)孽陛(十六)　娑嚩(二合)(引)訶(十七)(或一百八徧或四十九徧)(遶壇畢首者白云)。
It was then that the Bhagavān addressed this topic.

source_sentence: 說此大寶廣博樓閣善住祕密根本陀羅尼已。
translation: After he taught this great precious, vast, and esoteric dhāraṇī of the well-established secret fundamentals.
Here on this earth.
Six kinds of earthquakes shook it.
It rained down a great precious rain.
And great precious flowers were produced.
All the people who came rejoiced.
They all rejoice.
They praise them as being unprecedented.
They can cause all good qualities to be accomplished.
They'll all achieve them.
They'll realize the ten stages (one prostration).

source_sentence: 第十發願回向(眾跪唱云)
translation: The tenth invocation is a vow of dedication of merit (the congregation kneels down and sings, saying.)
The monks (a certain person) and so forth.
We wholeheartedly vowed.
'May I accept the compassion of the buddhas.
They'll be pleased with their bodies and minds.
May it be through the authority of the dhāraṇī that merit and wisdom will be fully enhanced.
We hope that merit and wisdom will be perfectly enhanced.
I look up to the Śāriputra.
The spiritual light will candle my path to enlightenment.
I was able to meet the original teacher who made the great vow.
I've been gathered into the gate of right awakening.
His faculties are acute.
Their right mindfulness is clear.
He completely cultivates the six perfections.
He's liberated from all conditions.
What's desired is for self and others.
It's enjoyed to the fullest extent.
They all clearly demonstrate their present circumstantial and correct adornment.
At each time, he fully performs meditation and contemplates his mind.
He routed the armies of Māra.
Stably abiding in the site of enlightenment.
He teaches the marvelous meaning.
Attaining great wisdom, he also conducts great practices.
He personally inherits Mañjuśrī and Samantabhadra.
Fulfilling the great vow, he also carries out great compassion.
He introduced Avalokitêśvara and Kṣitigarbha.
He extensively undertakes Buddha-works.
They universally benefit all sentient beings.
He realizes the entry of supernormal powers.
They'll fully attain the Buddhahood.

source_sentence: 更願十方世界一切眾生。
translation: May all sentient beings in the world in the ten directions ...
May all sentient beings in the ten directions world ascend together to the site of well-being.
Assemble together in the abode of nonproductivity.
Whenever there's a will or a vow, they must make it follow their hearts.
He must make them follow his heart.
They want their officers to be venerable, their lives to last, and their rank to increase.
And his body will be as hard as adamant.
If he wishes for wealth, a handsome man with a full treasury.
And his family will have many jade trees.
So that when his life ends.
I'd like to be reborn in the Pure Land.
May he again wish for the three evil destinies.
Stopping suffering and sourness.
Because of the good roots I've cultivated.
I'll help them all.
They'll all escape the cycle of rebirth.
They'll be born in the paradise land.
There's no limit to space.

source_sentence: 我願無涯望佛垂慈證明攝受。
translation: My vow knows no limit. I hope the Buddha will have the compassion to prove it's acceptance.
After he makes the vow, he bows his head to the Three Treasures (one prostration).
"I salute the Three Treasures with reverence (one prostration).
(He rises and quietly adjusts his robes and adds incense to his head.
He made a chorus of Brahmā and said.)

source_sentence: 南無十方佛南無十方法南無十方僧(執爐問訊徐行遶壇)。
translation: "Namo buddhas of the ten directions, namo methods of the ten directions, and namo saṃgha of the ten directions (holding a stove, greeting him, and slowly circumambulating the altar).
"Homage to our original teacher, Śākyamuni Buddha!

source_sentence: 南無消災延壽藥師佛南無阿彌陀佛
translation: Homage to Amitâbha Buddha, the Medicine Buddha who has longevity and has eliminated disasters

source_sentence: 南無定光佛南無彌勒尊佛
translation: Homage to the Buddha of Meditative Light Homage to Venerable Maitreya Buddha

source_sentence: 南無大寶廣博樓閣善住秘密陀羅尼
translation: Homage to the Secret Dhāraṇī of the Well-Established Pavilion of the Great Jewel
Śāriputra's pagoda in the south

source_sentence: 南無文殊師利菩薩南無普賢王菩薩
translation: Homage to Mañjuśrī Bodhisattva Homage to Samantabhadra Bodhisattva

source_sentence: 南無觀世音菩薩南無地藏王菩薩
translation: Homage to Avalokitêśvara Bodhisattva Homage to Kṣitigarbha King Bodhisattva

source_sentence: 南無金剛手菩薩南無華嚴首菩薩
translation: Homage to Vajrapāṇi Bodhisattva Homage to Huayanshou Bodhisattva
(Returning to his place after the circumambulation, he again raised his head).

source_sentence: 自皈依佛當願眾生紹隆佛種發無上心自皈依法當願眾生深入經藏智慧如海自皈依僧當願眾生統理大眾一切無礙和南聖眾(復稱南無本師釋迦牟尼佛。
translation: As a convert to the Buddha, I hope sentient beings will promote the Buddha lineage and arouse the unsurpassed mind. As a convert to the Dharma, I hope sentient beings will delve into the sutra treasury and have wisdom like an ocean. As a convert to the saṃgha, I hope sentient beings will govern the masses and all the unhindered and holy multitudes of the South (Again, I'll call myself the original teacher Śākyamuni Buddha.
When he leaves the altar and enters the meditation hall, he recites a dhāraṇī with one mind.
He recites the dhāraṇī with one mind.
After he finishes the incense, he'll do it himself.")
Śāriputra's Repentance (end)
